intro: Paramignya andamanica, commonly known as the Andamanese paramignya, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
